start.text: Welcome, Cadet, to our underground hideout! I'm Professor Hatch, director of the Drake Breeder's Guild.
And I'm Dr. Weaver, head of Mission Control here in the heart of our subterranean base.
Our country -- the Wyvern Republic -- depends on its dragons for defense, but they are under attack from the evil Kingdom of Darkwell, and in danger of going extinct!

You are training to be part of an elite team of scientists who will help us bring dragons back from the brink! We want to assemble a small dragon squad to stage a behind-enemy-lines strike on the Darkwellians to end the war.
Time is running out and we need to train you fast! Come with me to the Sim Room. Click your VenturePad to navigate around the base.

end.text: By completing this mission, you’ve earned the right to use one of our most valuable tools: the Chromoscope.
The Chromoscope checks and displays chromosome alleles for each drake. It will be invaluable in your future missions!

dialog.text: Good to meet you, Cadet! I'm Professor Yeung, and I'm in charge of the Sim Room. We’re going to show you on this simulator how to breed five different kinds of drakes - with different combinations of arms, legs, wings, horns, and armor.
Remember, we learn what we can from drakes and then apply what we’ve learned to dragons.
Now let’s get going! Every moment lost could mean a dragon’s life! Click the screen to get started!

start.text: Attention, Cadet! I’m Colonel de Herrera, commander of the dragon pilots! We’re losing the war against Darkwell, so I will be leading the sneaky mission behind enemy lines!
Over the course of your service here with us, we will need your help understanding how to breed different types of drakes so that we can develop dragons that help Colonel de Herrera and his squad!
I hear you’ve been training in the Sim Room and show lots of promise! So let’s go back there and see if you can knock a few out of the park!
Open your VentureMap and head on over there with us. Quickly! We don’t have much time!

middle.text: Open your VentureMap and head on over to the Sim Room. Quickly! We don’t have much time!

end.text: Cadet, you’ve cleared a major hurdle and shown that you just might be able to help us save the day.

Yes, you have mastered a key skill. You now know how to manipulate alleles. Since alleles are different versions of genes, you can now help us select the genes we need to breed the dragons necessary for defeating Darkwell.
Well, let’s not celebrate yet. I’m getting word that Darkwellian spies have learned that there’s a new member of our team.
Right. And they’re trying to make life even more difficult for us now by stepping up their attacks on our remaining dragons!
Looks like this is going to be, um, down to the wire.

dialog.text: So, we need you to learn how to change alleles. Remember, alleles are different versions of a gene!
Right. So in this case you are going to use the simulator to learn how to change alleles for arms, legs, and wings to match the targeted drakes you see on the screen.
And it’s critical that you do it in as few moves as possible! So tap on the simulator and show us the shortest, quickest way to the finish line!
Okay, Cadet! You’ll be using the simulator to change alleles for arms, legs, and wings to match a target drake. But we’re gonna throw you a curveball!
Right. You don’t get to see how your drake looks until you submit your answer!
You make it through these higher levels of training, and you’re starting to play in the big leagues!
Is everything a silly sports analogy with you, de Herrera?
What can I say, Yeung? I’m a team player. Give it a shot.
Sigh. Okay, Cadet. The, um, ball is in your, uh, court. Please tap on the simulator and, see if you can, uh, hit any home runs.
Yeung shoots! She scores!

start.text: Listen up, Cadet! This is for your ears only! Aboveground, there’s a tunnel to this underground base, hidden in a cute, innocent-looking little cottage.
That cottage is home to the Drake Breeders’ Guild. It houses a veterinary clinic and store, which I run. The money made by the store helps pay for the secret work we do down here.
The Darkwellians have no idea that the Guild is just a front. The thing is, we suddenly need a lot more drakes than usual…
…And if a ton of drakes start coming and going from the cottage, the Darkwellians will get suspicious. So activate your VentureMap and come help us in the Hatchery.

middle.text: Activate your VentureMap and come help us in the Hatchery.

end.text: Oh no! I’m getting reports that Darkwell has found out about the secret messages we send via flying drakes to the Principality of Robinstone!
What? It must be those spies! If only we knew who they were!
Well, it gets even worse. They also know that the Kingdom of Bloomberg was going to grow crops for us. Darkwell is  going to kill two birds with one stone by polluting the skies.
Now our drakes won’t be able to fly to Robinstone, and Bloomberg’s crops will  be ruined.
Things are pretty grim, Cadet. We already had a couple of strikes against us, and we’re not gonna have many more chances at bat.

dialog.text: We’re short on cash and need to sell a few thousand wingless drakes as pets for toddlers.
Parents prefer wingless drakes because, well, flying drakes sometimes give the toddlers unexpected rides that go up about a quarter mile in the sky.
Yeah, and it’s bad enough that the flying drakes, um, expel their waste from way up there, but, uh, let’s just say a freaked out toddler can drop one heck of a load from a thousand feet.
So, we have to sort out four kinds of drake eggs – fast! Females with wings, females without wings, males with wings, and males without wings.
See the baskets and the big pile of eggs? Click over there and get sorting!
Hey Cadet! We need you to help us breed some drakes for farming!

Here’s the deal. The Darkwellians have ruined all of Wyvern’s crops. The Kingdom of Bloomberg has offered to grow extra crops for us, but they don’t have the resources for tilling all the extra fields. So we need to give them drakes that only have arms.
Arms-only drakes naturally burrow in soil and can help prepare fields for crops. It’s like they swim through it!
We need to quickly sort out three kinds of eggs – those with arms only, those with legs only, and those with both.
So check out the baskets and the giant egg pile, then tap over there and start sorting!
